faqs.Answer: Tandem is a free, collaborative, one-stop mobile app for managing financial relationships in a smart, social, and intuitive manner.  It helps you handle shared household expenses like splitting bills with roommates, and social engagements from road trips to birthday dinners. Using Tandem, you can help your son or daughter manage their finances when they're in college or traveling. You can care for an elderly family member who needs help managing her or his finances. You can add as many shared financial relationships as your busy life requires.
faqs.Question: What's Tandem?

faqs.Answer: Add accounts and bills, share accounts, share transactions, split expenses, ask for payments, send payments, upload and share images, monitor and analyze single and group finances.
faqs.Question: What can I do in Tandem?

faqs.Answer: Tandem is free to you and the people you invite to use it.
faqs.Question: What does Tandem cost?

faqs.Answer: Sign up for Tandem using your mobile number or Facebook account.  Tap Sign Up from the home screen and then follow the on-screen instructions to register with Tandem.
faqs.Question: How do I sign up?

faqs.Answer: If you have signed up using Facebook, you'll need to specify your PIN to login. If you have signed up using your mobile number, you can login using either password or PIN.
faqs.Question: How do I login?

faqs.Answer: When your accounts and bills are linked to Tandem, you will get notifications on low balances, bills due, and high credit card charges on your accounts as well as from the accounts others have shared with you. You can also select transactions from your accounts to share with people in your financial circles, or link them directly to your accounts.
faqs.Question: Why link my accounts to Tandem?

faqs.Answer: Add your checking, savings, credit card, loan, mortgage, insurance, utilities, phone and wireless, cable and satellite accounts held by US-based financial institutions and service providers.
faqs.Question: What type of accounts can I add?

faqs.Answer: Tap + from Account and then follow the on-screen instructions to find and add your accounts and bills from banks and service providers. We’ll suggest popular accounts that other people have linked.
faqs.Question: How do I add accounts and bills?

faqs.Answer: Tap Accounts to see the accounts and bills you've added. You'll also see the accounts and bills a person has shared with you.  Tap on an account or bill in the list to view details.
faqs.Question: How do I see accounts and bills I've added?

faqs.Answer: Your accounts are refreshed with the latest data available from your bank or service provider.  We'll notify you if we've been unable to refresh your account.
faqs.Question: How up-to-date are my accounts and bills?

faqs.Answer: Only you can update your credentials for an account you have added. People with whom you share an account cannot make updates to your account.
faqs.Question: Who gets to update an account I've added to Tandem?

faqs.Answer: Alerts bring your attention to an obligation such as paying a bill or a large credit card transaction.
faqs.Question: What are alerts?

faqs.Answer: Alerts are delivered to you in Activity. For example, you'll receive an alert when a large withdrawal is posted to a bank account or credit card you've added to Tandem. If you add a bill, look for a Bill Due Alert.
faqs.Question: How do I see alerts?

faqs.Answer: We've set up a starting trigger value for your alerts. Navigate to Settings and My Accounts to change the trigger value of an alert.
faqs.Question: How do I configure alerts?

faqs.Answer: Toggle alerts to ON when sharing an account with a circle.  Alternatively, share a single alert from Activity with a contact or a circle.
faqs.Question: How do I share alerts?

faqs.Answer: Tap Settings in the Tandem menu and tap My Circles. In the My Circles view select either SMS or Email.
faqs.Question: How do I pick a notification method for a circle?

faqs.Answer: To stop sending alerts for an account, tap Settings in the Tandem menu and tap My Accounts. Tap the relevant account and switch the alert toggle to OFF.
faqs.Question: How do I stop alerts?

faqs.Answer: Activity is your landing screen and your financial to-do list. It will show you invitations to join financial circles, payment requests, account alerts, comments, attachments, and so on.
faqs.Question: What’s the purpose of Activity?

faqs.Answer: Financial event cards appear in Activity and Circles. A financial event card "frames" a financial event. Examples of financial event cards include invitations, payment requests, notifications, and comments. Tap on a financial event card to see further detail.
faqs.Question: What's a financial event card?

faqs.Answer: Deleting from Activity is unnecessary as your most recent financial event cards appear at the top of your queue.
faqs.Question: Can I delete financial event cards from Activity?

faqs.Answer: A circle is a group of people with whom you share finances. A circle may have several members or just two members. Examples are roommates, couples, child college expenses, and group trips.
faqs.Question: What's a circle?

faqs.Answer: Circles are a convenient way of collaborating with other people who with whom you share finances. Circle members can share transactions, split expenses, ask for payment, upload and share images, and monitor and analyze finances. Set up a customized circle or let Tandem set one up for you (see “What can I do without setting up a circle” for more details).
faqs.Question: Why would I set up a circle?

faqs.Answer: You can set up a circle where you are the only member authorized to invite new members.  Alternatively, you can allow any circle member to invite new members as long as the existing circle members approve the incoming member.
faqs.Question: Who gets to be in my circle?

faqs.Answer: We'll send non-Tandem users a message to download and register. Once registered, we will deliver your invitation to join the circle.
faqs.Question: Do the people I invite have to be Tandem users?

faqs.Answer: See who is in a circle before you join by viewing the invitee list on the Invitation card delivered to Activity.
faqs.Question: How do I see who's been invited to a circle?

faqs.Answer: You can share specific transactions with individual(s) from your device contacts.
faqs.Question: Can I share an Expense without setting up a circle?

faqs.Answer: As a circle member you can share transactions, .jpg and .png images, accounts, bills, and alerts. Remember that whatever you share with a circle is visible to all members in the circle.
faqs.Question: What can I share in a circle?

faqs.Answer: Share accounts with members of a circle you create. You can also share accounts in a circle created by another Tandem user as long as that user allows you to share accounts.
faqs.Question: With whom can I share accounts?

faqs.Answer: Tap Account and then tap the relevant account or bill. Depending on your device, either swipe right, and tap Share or tap More Options to share the account with circle members.
faqs.Question: How do I share an account or bill?

faqs.Answer: Tap Account then tap the relevant linked account to see its transactions.  Select the expense transaction(s) from the account and tap Share.
faqs.Question: How do I share an expense?

faqs.Answer: You send messages to circle members through comments. Comment on other people's comments to interact. Go to Circle to comment on a circle, Activity to comment on a financial event card.
faqs.Question: How do I send a message?

faqs.Answer: Tap Settings in the Tandem menu and tap My Circles. You'll be offered the option of leaving the circle.
faqs.Question: How do I leave a circle?

faqs.Answer: Before you leave a Circle, you can delete the comments and attachments you shared with the members of the circle. Your shared Statements and Transactions remain visible. Past Alerts from the accounts you shared are visible to circle members, but future alerts are not visible. Members who remain in the circle aren't able to view the balances and transactions of the accounts and bills you previously shared with the circle.
faqs.Question: What happens to the data I've shared when I leave a circle?

faqs.Answer: If you manage the circle, you can remove a person from it.
faqs.Question: Can I remove someone from a circle?

faqs.Answer: You can share a billing account statement, request a payment, share transaction(s), share alert(s), and send payment(s) without creating a Circle. In this case, Tandem creates a Circle for you. Membership in this Circle is static and comprised of the person or people with whom you took action. You will not be able to share an account in a Circle created for you by Tandem.
faqs.Question: What can I do without setting up a circle?

faqs.Answer: Tap Payment from Activity or from Circle. Tap Request a Payment. Pick a circle or one or more contacts you owe. Enter an amount or let Tandem calculate the amount for you. Specify how to split the amount among the circle members or contacts.
faqs.Question: How do I ask someone to pay me?

faqs.Answer: Your Tab shows you what you owe and what you are owed. Tab is organized by user and shows the net of all payments and payment requests you and the user share with one another.
faqs.Question: How do I know what I owe and what I am owed?

faqs.Answer: What you owe is the sum of all the amounts you owe to others. It equals all the payment requests and payments sent to you minus all the payment requests and payments you sent.
faqs.Question: How does Tandem calculate what I owe?

faqs.Answer: What you owe is the sum of all the amounts others owe you. It equals all the payment requests and payments sent to you minus all the payment requests and payments you sent.
faqs.Question: How does Tandem calculate what is owed to me?

faqs.Answer: Tap Payment from Activity or from Circle. Tap Request a Payment. Pick a circle or one or more contacts who owe you. Enter an amount or let Tandem calculate the amount for you. Specify how to split the amount among the circle members or contacts. Exclude yourself from the amount split when you are asking for a reimbursement.
faqs.Question: How do I ask someone to reimburse me?

faqs.Answer: Yes, you can pay a person who isn't a member of your circle.  We'll message them about your payment and invite them to sign up for Tandem to view payment details.
faqs.Question: Can I pay a person who isn’t a member of a circle?

faqs.Answer: Yes, we allow you to pay more than you owe. The extra amount you pay shows in your Tab as an amount due to you from the person you pay.
faqs.Question: Can I pay a person more than I owe them?

faqs.Answer: Yes, we allow you to pay less than you owe. We will recalculate the amount you owe based on what you pay.
faqs.Question: Can I pay a person less than I owe them?

faqs.Answer: Tap Payment and then Send a Payment.  Tap on any member to initiate payment. Tandem launches the Venmo interface for you to complete your payment.
faqs.Question: How do I pay a circle member from Payment?

faqs.Answer: From Tab, tap on any member who you owe or who owes you. Tap Record Payment and follow the on-screen instructions to record a cash payment.
faqs.Question: How do I record a cash payment I made to a person?

faqs.Answer: Tap Payment and then Send a Payment. Tap the info button to see payment activity details.  Tap Record Payment to capture the cash payment you received.  Alternatively, from the Tab, navigate to the details for a member you owe and tap Record Payment.
faqs.Question: How do I record the cash a person paid me?

faqs.Answer: Tap Tab for a list of members you owe. Tap Pay to initiate a payment.  Confirm or change the prefilled amount and description while making the payment. Tandem launches the Venmo interface for you to complete your payment.
faqs.Question: How do I pay a circle member from Tab?

faqs.Answer: From Tab, navigate to details screen of a person who owes you.  Tap on the Remind option.
faqs.Question: How do I remind a person to pay me?

faqs.Answer: Venmo is an app that allows you to move money. Tandem interfaces directly with Venmo, allowing you to make and receive payments.
faqs.Question: What's Venmo?

faqs.Answer: Yodlee ensures the highest levels of security to meet and exceed financial industry and federal regulatory standards. Tandem uses hardware encryption for maximum security of data and extensive security-related monitoring of systems, applications, and networks. Yodlee security is tested on a continuous basis by industry leading security firms and financial institutions.
faqs.Question: How safe is my data?

faqs.Answer: Once you sign-up for Tandem, your profile information - first name, last name, mobile number and email address - is visible to other members of your circle(s). The data that you share is only visible to the person(s) or circle member(s) whom you share it with.
faqs.Question: Is my data public?

faqs.Answer: We collect your first name, last name, gender and profile picture from Facebook.
faqs.Question: What data does Tandem collect from Facebook?

faqs.Answer: We'll send you a message with a link to reset your password. You'll need the answer to your security question before you can reset your password. If you have forgotten your answer to the security question, tap on Feedback to send us a service request.
faqs.Question: How do I reset my Password?

faqs.Answer: If you have signed up using mobile number and if you remember your password, you can login and reset your PIN. Otherwise, we'll send you a message with a link to reset your PIN. You'll need the answer to your security question before you can reset your PIN. If you have forgotten your answer to security question, tap on Feedback to send us a service request.
faqs.Question: How do I reset my PIN?

faqs.Answer: You can tap Feedback from the side menu and send across your request. Alternatively you can directly reach out to us at tandemsupport@yodlee.com. Once we disable your PIN based login, you will need to reinstall the app and login. You will need to login using your password from here on.
faqs.Question: How do I disable PIN based login?

faqs.Answer: You'll need to provide your mobile number and password if you had signed up using your mobile number. Alternatively, if you had signed up using Facebook, then you'll need to provide your Facebook credentials and PIN. Once you login successfully, you'll need to tap on the link we send you to confirm that the device belongs to you.
faqs.Question: How do I login using a different device?

faqs.Answer: Tap Feedback from the side menu. We'll create a service request using the information you provide and respond to you promptly. If you're unable to access Tandem, please email us at TandemSupport@Yodlee.com.
faqs.Question: How do I get help?
